pageContext.claim: “You need it [a citizenship question on the Census form] for many reasons. … You need it for Congress, for districting. You need it for appropriations. Where are the funds going? How many people are there? Are they citizens? Are they not citizens? You need it for many reasons.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a big contradiction. The Trump administration spent more than a year arguing in courts that it needed to add a Census citizenship question to improve enforcement of the Voting Rights Act. But Trump now says the purpose was to determine how many undocumented immigrants reside in the country for electoral districting and congressional funding purposes.
